March 5, 1951
Mr. Harold Safford
Program Director-WLS
1230 YJashington Boulevard
Chicago, Illinois
Dear Mr. Safford;
I talked to Miss Wetzler this morning on the telephone.
She suggested that I write to you to request copies of "The Hew
World of Atomic Energy*. As you know, WLS and Mr. Snyder have
generously allowed the NAEB to offer this program to its member
stations pending approval by the unions.
We are in receipt of letters from Mr. Heslep of the
Atomic Energy Commission and the unions. The musician1s union
has given blanket clearances. AFRA wants more specific informa¬
tion, but it seems certain that they will grant the clearance
when we send them the list of stations that will carry the
programs. Therefore, I will inventory our stations and send
a list of same to AFRA headquarters, on the assumption that they
will grant the necessary clearances.
Meanwhile, if you would be so kind as to send the copies
to us, we can begin to make copies and get them ready for dis¬
tribution. When we have done this, we will return your copies.
Be assured that we will not issue the program until written
clearances are obtained from AFRA.
Thank you for your trouble and may I again extend our
deepest gratitude to WLS for making this series available to us.
With warmest regards,
Cordially,
Richard L. Rider
Manager
NAEB TAPE NETWORK
